Package moulton.scalable.texts

Class LineBreak

java.lang.Object
moulton.scalable.texts.LineBreak
public class LineBreak
extends java.lang.Object
The Line Break class serves as a utility for text based classes, such as the TextHistory and the TextBox. A LineBreak instance can be generated through check(boolean, String, String). The instance will have data about how the text should be broken, such as the remaining line (LINE), the remaining text after the break (REMAINDER), and whether any characters were consumed (CHAR_CONSUMED). These fields are public for easy access, but final to prevent data corruption.
Author:
Matthew Moulton

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    boolean CHAR_CONSUMED
    Whether a character was consumed in the line break.
    java.lang.String LINE
    The text that is recommended to remain on the line.
    java.lang.String RAW_LINE
    The text that is recommended to remain on the line in addition to any characters that were considered to be consumed by the line break.
    java.lang.String REMAINDER
    Text that was broken from the first line and is recommended to be placed on a successive line.

  • Field Details

    • LINE

      public final java.lang.String LINE
      The text that is recommended to remain on the line. This field does not include any characters that were consumed. If those characters are needed for further calculations, use RAW_LINE.

    • RAW_LINE

      public final java.lang.String RAW_LINE
      The text that is recommended to remain on the line in addition to any characters that were considered to be consumed by the line break. If no characters were consumed, this will be equal to LINE.

    • REMAINDER

      public final java.lang.String REMAINDER
      Text that was broken from the first line and is recommended to be placed on a successive line. check(boolean, String, String) only computes one break at a time, so this text may need to be broken further.

    • CHAR_CONSUMED

      public final boolean CHAR_CONSUMED
      Whether a character was consumed in the line break. If a character was consumed, LINE and REMAINDER will exclude it.

  • Constructor Details

    • LineBreak

      protected LineBreak​(java.lang.String line, java.lang.String rem)
      Creates a line break instance as initializes the constant values. Sets CHAR_CONSUMED to false, and RAW_LINE to LINE.
      Parameters:
      line - the text for the line
      rem - the text left over from line

    • LineBreak

      protected LineBreak​(java.lang.String line, java.lang.String rawLine, java.lang.String rem)
      Creates a line break instance as initializes the constant values. Sets CHAR_CONSUMED to true.
      Parameters:
      line - the text for the line, excluding the consumed character
      rawLine - the text for the line, including the consumed character
      rem - the text left over from line

  • Method Details

    • check

      public static LineBreak check​(boolean wordSplit, java.lang.String line, java.lang.String rem)
      Splits the line of text and returns an instance holding the results of the split.

      It is assumed that prior to this method call, the contents of line have been found to be one character too long. Therefore, a split must occur for the line to fit properly. If wordSplit is true, then the algorithm does not need to worry about splitting words, and the last character from line will be placed at the beginning of rem. However, if wordSplit is false, an appropriate splitting place (such as a space, hyphen, or new line character) will be searched for. Yet, if no appropriate splitting place is found in the contents of line, a split will be performed as if wordSplit was true.

      White space characters (such as a space or new line) will be consumed if they are split on. Consumed characters will not be included in the line result or the remainder, but can be accessed as RAW_LINE.

      Parameters:
      wordSplit - whether words may be split midway when not necessary (this is useful if spaces have no inherent meaning as dividers in the text (for example, in encrypted text). For most cases, wordSplit = true is recommended.
      line - the offending line that is one character too long. Once line has been trimmed by this method, the result will be available as LINE.
      rem - the remainder text from this line. Text that does not fit in LINE will be placed at the front of this string, called REMAINDER in the result.
      Returns:
      the line break instance, containing the result data of the split.
